p: Aerial parts of two samples of B. rigidum subsp. paniculatum (~1 kg) were collected from field-growing plants in the flowering stage in central Portugal [A—Coimbra region (40°14′52.4″ N 8°25′14.1″ W), B—Fatima region (39°37′28.6″ N 8°41′19.7″ W)]. Voucher specimens were deposited at the herbarium of the Department of Life Sciences of the University of Coimbra (COI).
